abstract: Commerce Dept reports that orders for non-defense capital goods dropped 0.6 percent in December, far below economist expectations, as overall orders for durable goods decline by 3.4 percent; also reports rise in new-home sales and consumer confidence; data, along with several other reports, suggests mixed economic performance as falling oil prices and slow global growth weigh on United States economy.
lead_paragraph: Various reports on Tuesday gave an uneven view of the economy, hinting at damage from slower global growth and falling oil prices. Even so, both consumer confidence and new home sales rose.
snippet: Various reports on Tuesday gave an uneven view of the economy, hinting at damage from slower global growth and falling oil prices. Even so, both consumer confidence and new home sales rose.

headline.main: Mixed Signals in Raft of Economic Data
headline.print_headline: Mixed Signals in Raft of Economic Data
